title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB:
The test.class is then put in subpackage\subpackage directory. Running the java command results in
   Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test
EB:
Running either of the following commands should fix the problem:
   ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
   javac subpackage\Test.java
SR:
Compile the class using the command:
   ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java or javac subpackage\Test.java
